marketNews.title: 2024 Issuer Performance Compilation: Part 2
marketNews.content: After releasing the performance compilation of issuers in consumer-related sectors in Stockbit Snips previously, we also created a compilation of FY24 performance from issuers closely related to industrials, including cement, building materials, automotive, utilities, industrial property, industrial supports. Here is the breakdown of revenue, operating profit, and net profit for each sector: .png) Key Takeaway - Generally, the revenue trend for industrial issuers is still growing positively year-on-year, both in 4Q24 and in FY24. Although total revenue only grew slightly by +0.1% YoY in 4Q24 and +2% YoY during FY24, this figure was mainly caused by a revenue decline in the industrial support sector. Beyond that, the revenue of other sectors grew quite well. - From the aspect of operating profit margin, there was a tendency for margin weakening during FY24, although there were signs of recovery in 4Q24 in the cement and building materials sectors. Thus, operating profit tended to grow lower compared to revenue. - On the bottom line, there were several boosts to net profit in several sectors, such as lower interest and tax expenses in the utilities sector and asset sales in the automotive sector. Highlights of several sectors include: - Industrial property had the relatively best performance during FY24, with revenue and net profit growing by +25% YoY and +14% YoY, respectively, driven by high industrial land sales from land purchases made by BYD. - Industrial support (AKRA) recorded negative performance during FY24 with a revenue decrease of -8% YoY and net profit of -20% YoY, primarily due to price normalization in the oil distribution and trade segment and lower JIIPE land sales. - The cement sector booked a significant recovery continuation in 4Q24 with net profit growing by +39% YoY, mainly driven by margin improvement from lower energy costs.

marketNews.title: Macroeconomic and Global Updates
marketNews.content: The Head of the Macroprudential Policy Department of Bank Indonesia, Solikin M. Juhro, said on Wednesday (26/3) that Indonesia's current economic fundamentals remain solid and are not as vulnerable as during the 1998 crisis. Solikin's comment emerged after the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakened up to the level of 16,641 on Tuesday (25/3) morning, marking the weakest level since June 1998. Juhro stated that Indonesia currently has a stronger policy design, macroeconomic governance, and financial stability supervision system compared to 27 years ago. He added that the central bank will continue to monitor and maintain financial stability together with the government. US President, Donald Trump, on Wednesday (26/3) signed a proclamation to implement a 25% tariff on car imports starting April 3, 2025, designed to bring more manufacturing jobs to the US. The tariff will apply not only to completely built-up imported cars but also target spare parts, including engines, transmissions, powertrain components, and electrical components. Tariffs on spare parts will take effect no later than May 3, 2025, with the list of affected spare parts potentially expanded in the future. Special Staff to the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Raden Pardede, said on Thursday (27/3) that President Prabowo Subianto will meet with investors after the Eid al-Fitr holiday, aiming to correct misperceptions regarding government policy. Previously, the Chairman of the National Economic Council, Luhut Pandjaitan, claimed on Wednesday (26/3) that President Prabowo intends to meet directly with investors and capital market analysts to ensure a healthy and competitive investment climate, although he did not elaborate further. Meanwhile, the President Director of the IDX, Iman Rachman, said on Thursday (27/3) that so far his office has not received information regarding President Prabowo Subianto's planned meeting with capital market players. Since the beginning of the year, the IHSG has weakened by -8% YTD as of Thursday (27/3), in line with the emergence of several negative sentiments from domestic issues and global uncertainty from trade war escalations. Reuters reported that an entity controlled by the Widjaja family has offered to buy out the remaining public shares in Sinar Mas Land (SGX: A26) listed on the Singapore exchange. The transaction plan was offered at 0.31 Singapore dollars per share, which is 12.7% higher than Sinar Mas Land's last trading price. The Widjaja family currently owns 65.75% of Sinar Mas Land through their family trusts. The Widjaja family stated that the offer provides an opportunity for Sinar Mas Land shareholders to exit and reinvest their capital directly into Sinar Mas group property companies listed on the IDX, such as Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) and Puradelta Lestari (DMAS). Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) announced on Wednesday (26/3) that the iPhone 16 series will start selling in Indonesia on April 11, 2025, following the lifting of the sales ban after the company agreed to an investment plan worth over 300 million US dollars in Indonesia. Previously, the government banned the sale of the iPhone 16 series in 2024 because Apple failed to meet the domestic component level (TKDN) requirements.

tickerNews.title: BMRI: Cum Date & Dividend Payment Schedule Announced
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri announced that the cum-dividend date for the 2024 fiscal year in the regular and negotiation markets falls on April 11, 2025, with payment on April 23, 2025. This week, the BMRI AGM approved the plan for the final dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 43.5 trillion Rupiah or about 466.2 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 78% dividend payout ratio and indicating a yield of 9% as of Thursday (27/3).

tickerNews.title: BBRI: Cum Date & Dividend Payment Schedule Announced
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia announced that the final cum-dividend date for the 2024 fiscal year in the regular and negotiation markets falls on April 10, 2025, with payment on April 23, 2025. This week, the BBRI AGM approved the plan for the final dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 52 trillion Rupiah or 208.4 Rupiah per share, equivalent to an 86% dividend payout ratio and indicating a yield of 5.1% as of Thursday (27/3). Previously, BBRI distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 135 Rupiah per share in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADMF: Dividend Distribution for Fiscal Year 2024
tickerNews.content: Adira Dinamika Multi Finance will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 703 billion Rupiah or 703 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 50% dividend payout ratio. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is April 11, 2025, while payment is on April 25, 2025. Referring to ADMF's stock price at the market close on Thursday (27/3) at 9,200 Rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 7.6%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN: Dividend Approval and BTN Syariah Spin-off Target
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara shareholders approved the plan for the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution amounting to approximately 751.8 billion Rupiah or about 53.6 Rupiah per share, equivalent to a 25% dividend payout ratio. The cum-dividend date and payment date have not yet been announced. Referring to BBTN's stock price at the market close on Thursday (27/3) at 885 Rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 6.1%. Following the AGM on Wednesday (26/3), the President Director of BBTN, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, stated that they target the spin-off process of BTN Syariah to be completed in 3Q25.

tickerNews.title: BUKA: Realization of Share Buyback Program
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak announced that it has realized a buyback of 220 million (0.21%) shares on March 26, 2025, at an average price of approximately 143 Rupiah per share, totaling approximately 31.5 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, BUKA still has remaining funds for share buyback amounting to approximately 1.87 trillion Rupiah. Previously, BUKA announced a share buyback plan with funds up to 1.9 trillion Rupiah from March 26 to June 25, 2025, although the company did not specify the number of shares to be purchased in this corporate action.

tickerNews.title: MYOR: Share Buyback Plan Announced
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah plans a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 1 trillion Rupiah from March 27 to June 27, 2025, although the company did not specify the number of shares to be purchased. This plan does not require AGM approval, in line with the relaxation provided by OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: SILO: Syndicated Loan Facility Secured and 2024 Performance Review
tickerNews.content: Siloam International Hospitals signed a syndicated loan facility agreement of up to 14.5 trillion Rupiah from Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA), Bank Central Asia (BBCA), Bank DBS Indonesia, MUFG Bank, and HSBC. This facility consists of a term loan with a 7-year maturity, a revolving credit facility, and other supporting facilities. SILO explained that this transaction is in line with its business expansion plans and corporate strategy. SILO recorded a net profit of 267 billion Rupiah in 4Q24 (-24% YoY, -17% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 of 902 billion Rupiah (-26% YoY) and below expectations (84% of 2024F consensus estimate). In the earnings call on Thursday (27/3), SILO management stated that they will wait until after 2Q25 before providing guidance, considering macroeconomic volatility.

tickerNews.title: CBDK: Capital Injection into Subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses announced that it has injected capital into 2 of its subsidiaries, namely PT Mega Andalan Sukses and PT Cahaya Gemilang Indah Cemerlang, amounting to 308 billion Rupiah and 89.6 billion Rupiah, respectively, through the issuance of new shares entirely subscribed by the company. After this transaction, CBDK's ownership in PT Mega Andalan Sukses and PT Cahaya Gemilang Indah Cemerlang increased from the level of 55.89% to 64.62% each.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Director and Independent Commissioner Resignations
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) announced that Suparno Djasmin and Bambang Permadi Soemantri Brodjonegoro have submitted resignation letters from their respective positions as director and independent commissioner of the company. Suparno's resignation is related to retirement, while Bambang's resignation is in connection with his appointment as Dean of The Asian Development Bank Institute.

tickerNews.title: PTRO and Partner Form Joint Venture PT Portus Bara Jaya
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) through its subsidiary, PT Petrosea Infrastruktur Nusantara, along with PT Lautan Hutan Lestari, formed a joint venture named PT Portus Bara Jaya. The joint venture will support business activities and expand the company's business network in mining services. PT Portus Bara Jaya was established with a total placed and paid-up capital of 162.7 billion Rupiah, with PT Petrosea Infrastruktur Nusantara's ownership portion reaching 50%.
